entry.title: Re: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a...
entry.content:
@tsuuuu 

Use a Scriptvariable and bind it to a dynamic text and place it on chart Title Area.

The below code can get you the max date. Place it on initialisation or Table refresh.

//Read Table Date Filter

var datefilter=Table_1.getDataSource().getDimensionFilters("Date"); // Adjust your table name

var strFilter = [""];

if (datefilter[0].type === FilterValueType.Single){
var sfv = cast(Type.SingleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
 strFilter = [sfv.value];
}
else{
var mfv = cast(Type.MultipleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
for (var i=0, len=mfv.values.length; i< len; i++)
{
strFilter.push(mfv.values[i]);
}
var laststrFilter = strFilter.slice(-1);
}

var dateString = laststrFilter[0].split('&[')[1];
ScriptVariable_1 = dateString.slice(0, -1); //Adjust as per your script variable

Output

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: End to End Activation Guide for S/4HANA public Cloud and SAP Business AI - Joule
entry.content:
SAP Business AI - Joule in S/4HANA public Cloud

    End-to-End activation guide for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP AI-Copilot

 

  1. Introduction:

SAP Business AI is SAP‚Äôs integrated approach to bringing artificial intelligence directly into business processes, applications, and user experiences.

Its core strength is contextual intelligence‚Äîleveraging master and transactional data while respecting each user‚Äôs role and authorizations.

There are two Main pillars in SAP AI Strategy.

  • Custom AI Solutions via SAP BTP AI Services ‚Äì e.g., SAP AI Core, Launchpad services.
  • Business AI ‚Äì native AI capabilities embedded across SAP‚Äôs applications.

 

 

  1. In a previous blog, I covered building custom AI in BTP . ‚Äú#Vectorize your data for Infuse AI in to Business using Hana Vector and Generative AI‚Äù.
  2. This post focuses on the second pillar‚ÄîStarting from a clean SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant activation and enabling Business AI - Joule (AI copilot) setup.

2 On-Boarding process of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition for TDD:

This section covers entitlement ordering, system provisioning, tenant activation, identity services setup, and post-onboarding configurations for the Test, Demo & Development (TDD) edition.

2.1 Order the CBC, IAS/IPS & S4 Tenants :

Log in to SAP Partner Portal with your S-user. [ https://partneredge.sap.com/].

Request TDD license; admin receives welcome emails with CBC, IAS/IPS & S/4 tenant URLs and admin credentials.

2.2 Provisioning  the Technical System:

System provisioning can be done  via 'SAP for Me‚Äô.

The sequence of system provisioning should be CBC , CIS Sync up[IAS/IPS], SAP S/4 HANA Dev and Customizing Tenant.

2.3 CBC Set up:

  1. Configure Scope and Organisational Structure in CBC.
  2. Create an Evaluation Project (not Implementation).
  3. Assign required CBC roles.
  4. Select demo data during initial project setup.
  5. Ensure deployment targets point to your S/4HANA Public Cloud URL.

 

           

2.4 Additional CBC Set UP and guidelines:

  • Find CBC URL: CIS ‚Üí Applications ‚Üí XSUAA ‚Üí CBC ‚Üí Home URL.
  • Replicate CBC groups to CIS via IPS resync job.
  • Assign correct CBC roles in IAS and maintain correct user IDs to avoid login issues.
  • Validate target system properties in CBC admin console.

 

2.5 User Setup in CIS & S/4:

Once all the set ups are done , you can see the below FLP looks like this.

You can use the identity access MGMT tile to onboard the new users , roles and groups.

By default, the Super Admin is assigned the SAP_BR_Administrator role along with other standard SAP roles in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud application.

The best practice is to Create the custom roles from the template and assign to the user instead of assign the standard role.

To onboard a new user you can follow the below steps in CIS and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

3. Enabling Business AI Copilot (Joule) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

This purpose of this guide is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to set up a Joule that can work in SAP SAP S/4 HANA public Cloud Edition.

3.1 Validate the Joule service assignment.

 In BTP Entitlements, ensure Joule is assigned.

Add missing service plans and Save

        

 

3.2 Validate SAP BTP Build Work Zone- Standard Edition.

  • Add Work Zone in entitlements if missing.
  • Ensure Joule and Work Zone are in the same global account, subaccount, and region where Joule is available.
  •  you need to carefully choose the right data center where Joule is available and nearest to your location.

       

3.3 Validate the System Registration in BTP : [Auto-Discovered / Manual]

In the SAP BTP cockpit, you can have the overview of all your systems associated with your customer ID. These systems can be registered or auto discovered.

Make sure that your SAP S/4 HANA DEV and Customizing Tenants ,  CIS Tenant  and CBC Tenants which you are configured earlier are exists here . If not you need to add it manually in the BTP Global Account √† System Landscape Systems link.

 

3.4 Get the token for your system from BTP and Register it in S/4HANA Cloud Tenant

Choose your SAP S/4 HANA public cloud Tenant in the system Landscape-->Systems--> Choose All Communication Scenarios --> Get Token

Capture the registration token and keep  and login in to SAP S/4 HANA cloud .

Register this token in Maintain extension link and Click on Approve  button as YES.

 

Once this is completed , Refresh the system landscape button , and you can see your SAP S/4 HANA cloud system status shown as registered in green color.

3.5 Set up the subaccount , Spaces and Cloud Foundry.

As part of your sub account creation , make sure that you are going to choose the right region where joule data centers are available.

Once sub account has been created , create the Cloud Foundry and Space.

3.6 Set up the Entitlement in the subaccount.

Go to your subaccount √† Entitlements--> Add service Plan -->Search Joule and work zone and add those services.

  • Setup Trust Configuration

From the Navigation Pane on the left, select Trust Configuration. Click Establish Trust.

From the CIS  tenants, choose the one that is also used by your applications and click Next.
Note: The tenant chosen here must be the same as the one used by SAP S/4 HANA Cloud application for which Joule is configured.

3.7 Trust the Domain in BTP.

Need to  add the Trusted Domains. To do this, click on the Settings options in the Subaccount and click on Add under Trusted Domain.

   

3.8 Trust the Domain in SAP Cloud Identity Services

Click on CIS√† Applications and Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> and then click on Customization -> click on the Trusted Domains option -> add your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URLs

3.9 Create the service key for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

This  Service Key which will be used during the destination creations and for SAP CIS ‚Äì Identity Provisioning Services (source & target) role mapping to your Work Zone.

 

Assign the required roles as well for the users.

3.10 Run the Joule Booster in the BTP Global account

BTP Global Account--> click Boosters >> search for Joule >> click Start on Setting up Joule tile.

 

 

Finally you will get the success message like this.

3.11 Post Booster Validation.

The formation created here is a logical grouping of SAP systems. Once the formation is created, you can include an SAP solution system in it and change it anytime.

 

 

3.12 Create Navigation Service Destination

We need the destination services for Joule to work with your LoB applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. To create this, SAP BTP Subaccount, --> Connectivity option --> Destination --> Create New Destination.

 

You have to use the Service Key for the Joule.

This contains client id , secret  Token URL..etc.

3.13 SAP S/4HANA Destinations setup in BTP Subaccount 

Navigate in to BTP Sub Account  --> Click Connectivity -> Destinations and confirm the destinations required for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are successfully created in your BTP Subaccount. The following 5 destinations should already exist in your BTP S4HANA_PUB_SSO

  • SAP S/4HANA SSO
  • Joule Design time Destination
  • Joule Run time Destination
  • Runtime Default
  • Runtime Datas

Already you have created the ‚Äúnavigation service‚Äù manually.

3.14 Validate the Communication Arrangements:

Navigate in to  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System -->  launch the Communication Arrangements Tile.

Confirm that Communication Arrangements with Scenario ID SAP_COM_0647 and SAP_COM_0882 are automatically added by the Joule booster.

 

 Make sure SAP_COM_0647 exposure role collection is set to ALL.

 

The navigate in to Communication Systems Tile.

You can 4 new systems are created. The System ID and System Names will have cryptic values.

3.15 Create the Inbound Communication System:

Navigate to Communication system √† Create the new one-->Specify the host name and port and create the communication user Id and proposed  password.

For the communication arrangement choose SAP_COM_0193  and save it.

3.16 Create Communication Use for the communication System step

Create the  Communication User . Navigate to --> Maintain Communication Users -> Click on New and enter the details 

Capture this user id and password will be used in Source system creation step.            

3.17 Manage Content Security Policy

Navigate to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud--> Manage Content Security Policy √† Trusted Sites--> Managed By--> UI_RESOURCES_SCRIPTS --> Managed by Customer tab--> Add the URL of the Joule.

This Joule URL you can get it from the BTP cockpit ‚Äì Joule Service.           

3.18 Configure the IDP for SSO set up between Source and the Target System.

Here the

  • Source system is SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
  • Target system is SAP BTP Build zone standard edition.

You have option to create the system manually or upload the template of Source and Target System.

Find the attachment of the ZIP file.  From this template you can easily create the source and target files.

 

Go to CIS console -->  IDP --> Source System --> Click Add --.> Browse and Upload the Source File.

Update the properties as per screen shot.

Here you need to update the User and Password captured from the STEP 15 [Communication user creation step in S/4 HANA]

 

Target System Creation:

Upload Target JSON file by click on ADD button in the IDP-->Target system.

Proceed the update the details and properties.

Source System -  Earlier you created.

cflp.providerId :   ID of the S/4 content provider created in Work Zone.

URL : portal-service url from the from the  Work Zone instance in BTP.

OAuth2TokenServiceURL :  URL from the Work Zone instance in BTP should be ends woth oauth/token.

User: clientid 

Password: clientsecret 

3.19 Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone

Navigate in to Identity Provisioning >> Source Systems--> Choose the system you created --> Job--> Read Job--> Click Run Now button.

In the provisioning Logs , verify the log status.

You can find the status of the user and groups  in Work Zone channel manager by click on refresh button.

3.20 Verify Joule in SAP Fiori Launch Pad / Work Zone.

Enter the URL of the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in the browser --> You can notice the DIAMOND icon of  JOULE in the TOP right corner.

Open and enter your queries in the interactive assistant.

4 Conclusion:

In this blog post , I have covered the end-to-end steps for set up the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant in TDD environment and activate the Business AI- Joule.

Following that I provided the detailed steps like Onboarding , Provisioning the system, CBC set up, CIS IAS /IPS set ups , BTP service activation ,  Boosters for the service , System and user set up , Trust and SSO set ups.

entry.title: Re: Software Architecture Pattern for SAP B1
entry.content:
Hello Lucas,

In my opinion SAP built the SDK (specially UI API) using event driven architecture. At that time, MVC pattern doesn't existed as we know (I am speculating here).  

But, I prefer built MVC pattern on top of the SDK. You can check this repository on github for reference: https://github.com/WilliamWachholz/B1Base.

It is a framework that was built on top of the SDK and it abstracts this event driven pattern and uses MVC architecture.

Please let me know if it helps.

Best regards

Hi ,

If you have updated the transformation to trigger the email - it would send the mail when users are synced for the first time.

Transformation should look like this

 {

entry.title: Crystal charts are not working in Visual Studio 2022. It is using 32 bit not 64 bit.
entry.content:
Charts/graphs are not working in Visual studio 2022.  They are working in crystal 2020 on the same machine.

We received a Crystal Report containing several charts, which was uploaded to a Visual Studio 2022 ASP.NET Crystal Report website using C#. The goal was to create a webpage hosted in IIS to view the report. The report functions perfectly in the standalone Crystal Reports application 2020 and opens it very quickly. We modified the project to host the report, including the web.config files, ODBC connections, and the default file pointing to the report. We followed all the standard procedures that had worked for another 200 reports without charts. The Crystal Reports .NET runtime for Visual Studio 2022, both 32 and 64-bit (all software is version 38), was installed on the server. With everything set up, we were prepared to check the preview using the Crystal Viewer embedded in the Crystal extension tab in Visual Studio. When previewing the report, the initial drop-down to select data functioned correctly, but when the report attempted to display the charts, a quick message appeared stating: "Crystal Report viewer: memory full." The project was compiled, the website was created, and added to IIS, yet the same error appeared on the created website: "not enough memory for operation." The server has ample disk space and RAM (32 GB), and we do not observe the memory usage spiking. Final test we create a simple report with all the updated tools in crystal reports, simple data, pretty much it was just a chart, but when we add the project in in visual studio it had the same result. Can you assist me in resolving this issue? please search deep if necessary.

1060

NUM-GAAU** Subtraction

entry.title: Re: FINT and value date for outstanding receivables
entry.content:
By default, transaction FINT calculates interest on cleared items using:

Due Date ‚Üí Clearing Date

This is hardcoded into the logic, and while you can tweak transfer days, tolerance days, and calendars, these are approximations ‚Äî not substitutes for using the actual value date from EBST.

Why this matters is because, with real-time payments, the value date (when the money is actually available) can differ from the clearing date (when SAP marks the item as cleared). This gap can distort interest calculations, especially in high-volume or high-value receivables environments.

You can explore some of the below approaches

1. Custom Enhancement via BTE or User Exit
Use Business Transaction Events (BTE) or user exits in the interest calculation program to override the clearing date with VALUT. Read the value date from the FEBEP or FEBKO table (bank statement line items).

2. Custom Interest Indicator
Create a custom interest indicator that flags items for alternate logic. Use this to selectively apply VALUT-based interest calculation only for SEPA or real-time payments.

3. Reporting-Based Solution
If posting logic is too complex to change, consider a reporting-only solution. Build a Z-report that calculates interest days using due date ‚Üí VALUT. Use it for internal analysis or audit purposes

entry.title: üü£ Best Practices for Quickly Building Extensions to SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs dynamic business landscape, extending SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) empowers organizations to tailor solutions to their evolving needs. This technical session explores the extensibility wizard, which provides a unified experience for key users and developers across SAP applications.
 
The extensibility wizard supports in-app extensions for field and object customizations within SuccessFactors, as well as side-by-side extensions using SAP BTP‚Äôs Process Automation (SBPA) and Business Application Studio (BAS). SBPA enables complex workflow automation, while BAS supports the development of informative card extensions.
 
This session will cover practical aspects of implementing these extensions, including real-world examples and best practices. Attendees will learn how to integrate customizations seamlessly, automate processes, and create card extensions. Key benefits highlighted include tailored solutions for specific business requirements, improved user experience, and increased operational efficiency.
 
Join us to discover how SAP BTP and the extensibility wizard can unlock the full potential of your SAP SuccessFactors environment.

entry.title: Re: Implementation Guidance on EDI Integration in SAP S/4...
entry.content:
Hello @Mukesh_SEIL 

Thank you for your inquiry regarding EDI integration with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Based on your requirement for ANSI X12 transaction sets 830 ‚Äì Planning Schedule, 810 ‚Äì Invoice, 856 ‚Äì Advance Ship Notice, please find the recommended approach.

Integration Mechanism
The recommended middleware is SAP Integration Suite (CPI), which facilitates message exchange through standard APIs and connects to external EDI networks.

Scope Items
There is no dedicated EDI scope item in Public Cloud, but the solution supports integration through provided APIs and Integration Suite content packages. These enable inbound and outbound processing of schedules, invoices, and ASNs.

Mapping and Transformation
Use the Integration Content Advisor (ICA) within the Integration Suite to map ANSI X12 to SAP formats. ICA offers machine learning‚Äìpowered mapping accelerators, making it easier to maintain trading partner agreements.

Partner Connectivity
Connectivity can be established via AS2, SFTP, VAN providers, or SAP Business Network. Third-party providers, such as TrueCommerce or Seeburger, are also supported for partner onboarding.

Monitoring and Error Handling
Integration Suite provides comprehensive monitoring dashboards for message tracking and error handling. Additionally, SAP offers APIs and logs to verify processing status in S/4HANA Cloud.

Summary:

  • Use SAP Integration Suite with ICA as the central integration layer.
  • Leverage standard APIs for inbound/outbound flows.
  • Connect partners via AS2, SFTP, VAN, or Business Network.
  • Monitor and handle errors using the Integration Suite monitoring tools.

References:

  • SAP Help ‚Äì Integration Suite
  • SAP Community ‚Äì EDI Integration Strategy for S/4HANA Cloud
  • SAP Learning ‚Äì Integration Content Advisor

Let me know it was helpful

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP CIS ‚Üî SAP Ariba User Provisioning Issue (SCIM Schema mismatch)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are currently implementing user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) and SAP Ariba and followed the official SAP guide:
üëâ SAP Ariba User Provisioning using SAP Identity Provisioning Service (IPS)

In this guide, it is recommended to create the following custom schema:

urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:vendor:ariba:2.0:User

We created this schema and successfully populated the attributes inside SAP CIS.
However, during provisioning from CIS to SAP Ariba, we noticed that the attributes are completely ignored and not recognized in Ariba.

The reason is a schema mismatch:

  • Schema delivered by CIS (wrong):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.ariba:2.0:User

  • Schema expected by Ariba SCIM API (correct):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:ariba:2.0:User

    The difference is small (sap.ariba vs. sap:ariba), but it prevents Ariba from accepting the attributes.
    As a result, although CIS contains the attributes, they never arrive in Ariba.

    Workaround we applied

    We manually built the correct Ariba schema in CIS, adjusted the user attributes, and extended the transformations accordingly. With this workaround, provisioning into Ariba now works as expected.

    Questions to the community

    1. Is this workaround acceptable as a long-term solution, or could it cause issues with future updates?

      We would greatly appreciate any insights or experiences with similar setups üôè

      Best regards,
      Said

entry.title: Re: Enabling Onboarding 2.0 without IAS
entry.content:
Hi @vthangaraj 

IAS is mandatory for Onboarding 2.0 due to the deprecation of Basic Authentication: Deprecation of Basic Auth/3rd Corporate Identity Provider (IdP) Direct Integration w/SuccessFactors, so it is not possible to implement it without IAS.

Previously there was the possibility of keeping onboardees on Basic Authentication, but since June 2th 2025, Basic Authentication reached end of maintenance and support.

For more information about the configuration, please refer to the Onboarding help portal: Setting up SAP Identity Authentication for New Hires Using System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) API

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports runtimes get corrupted
entry.content:
That error always means your project is loading different versions of the runtime due to multiple versions installed.

Also, SP 36 has issues, highly recommend updating to SP 38 from here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

And see my blog on upgrading, lots of info to pay attention to in it:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/upgrading-a-visual-studio-2008-gt-2022-net-project-with-the-latest-cr-net/ba-p/13469215

Make sure you don't have any CR dll's in your \bin folder, always set the Copy Local to false in Visual Studio for all CR assemblies. That can cause mismatched dll's to get loaded.

entry.title: Re: UKM000 BP Role Assigned Automatically During /SHCM/BU...
entry.content:
Some of the areas where you can investigate are

1. Check CVI Customizing for Role Assignment
Even if BAdIs aren‚Äôt active, CVI (Customer/Vendor Integration) settings may include default role assignment logic. Look into SPRO ‚Üí Cross-Application Components ‚Üí Master Data Synchronization ‚Üí Customer/Vendor Integration ‚Üí Business Partner Settings ‚Üí Settings for Vendor Integration ‚Üí Assign BP Role to Vendor Role. Sometimes, UKM000 gets assigned if the BP is flagged as a customer or vendor in the background ‚Äî even if it‚Äôs an employee.

2. Review Synchronization Program Logic
The program /SHCM/BUPA_SYNC_S may internally call routines that assign default roles based on BP category or usage. You can use debugging to trace the role assignment step. Look for internal calls to BUPA_ROLE_ADD_2 or similar FM and check if UKM000 is being added based on BP grouping or role mapping.

3. Check BP Grouping and Role Mapping
If your employee BP grouping is mapped to a role category that includes UKM000, it may be assigned automatically. Review BP Grouping ‚Üí Role Category Mapping. Role Category ‚Üí Role Assignment Defaults

entry.title: Re: HANA Partitioning - 2 billion rows limitation - Part I: BWoH / BW/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi Colm,

as written in the blog it was extracted from PDF which is located inside TABLE_PLACEMENT.zip of note 2334091. Now with the BW4HANA version it was slightly changed :

BWoH:

InfoObject tables (sap.bw.iobj) are not partitioned, except for InfoObjects with high cardinality and inbound and change log

tables of InfoObjects with enhanced master data update. Those tables are hash partitioned at the first level. All other

InfoObject tables are not partitioned. First level hash partitioned tables of InfoObjects have 1 hash partition regardless of

the number of records in the tables - except for tables with more than 1.5 billion records, see remarks below. InfoObject

tables are located on the coordinator node.

 

BW4HANA

InfoObject tables (sap.bw.iobj) are not partitioned, except for InfoObjects with high cardinality and inbound and change log

tables of InfoObjects with enhanced master data update. Those tables are hash partitioned at the first level. All other

InfoObject tables are not partitioned. First level hash partitioned tables of InfoObjects have 1 hash partition regardless of

the number of records in the tables - except for tables with more than 1.5 billion records, see remarks below. InfoObject

tables are located on worker nodes. All partitions of all tables in a table group are on the same node (slave#1).

 

Regards,

Jens

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502: Custom tile for Custom UI5...
entry.content:
Hello @urielalejo 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, you cannot copy or modify SAP-delivered tiles such as F2217 ‚Äì Display Line Item Entry.

The URL parameters P_FromPostingDate and P_ToPostingDate are not included in the app‚Äôs inbound navigation signature, so the system disregards them.

Options:

  • For custom UI5 applications, define your own tile and target mapping by using Maintain Launchpad App Descriptor Items, and include any necessary parameters.
  • For external apps, you can use Custom Tiles, but this won‚Äôt allow you to extend SAP standard apps.
  • For F2217, the recommended approach is to use the filter bar, set the Posting Date range, and then select Save as Tile to save those values.

You can check below SAP Documentations references

SAP Help ‚Äì Maintain Launchpad App Descriptor Items

SAP Help ‚Äì Custom Tiles

SAP Help ‚Äì Save/Manage Views and Save as Tile

With kind regards

Chuma

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

The above post also gives an update on building your own Joule agents, so I will not cover that here, but rather focus on web and mobile UI development.

 

Design News

SAP Design System Portal and UI Kits in Figma

We recently introduced the new SAP Design System portal that brings together the product design guidelines SAP Fiori for web, SAP Fiori for iOS, and SAP Fiori for Android, as well as to the new digital design system guidelines. With its enhanced usability, simplified versioning and improved performance, designers (and developers!) get a better user experience compared with the previous SAP Fiori design guidelines.

Figure 1: The SAP Design System portal start page. Alt Text: Image with header saying ‚ÄúSAP Design System‚Äù, with a ‚ÄúSee what‚Äôs new‚Äù button below it, and then four subsections in a horizontal row: SAP Fiori for Web, SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for iOS and SAP‚Äôs Digitial Design System. A ‚ÄúFeedback‚Äù button is on the bottom right.

The new UI Kits available for designers in Figma make it easy for designers to design accessible UIs at enterprise scale, for web applications, mobile iOS and Android applications as well as wearables. The UI Kits provide reusable components for web and mobile, along with web floorplans, which give you what you need out-of-the-box.

Figure 2: SAP‚Äôs UI Kits for Designers in Figma. Alt-Text: The image shows two rows of four cards representing UI Kits: SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for Web, Designing for Performance, SAP Fiori for iOS, SAP Fiori for watchOS, SAP Fiori for Wear OS, SAP S/4HANA for Web, and Accessibility Design Tools. On the very left of the image information about SAP is listed, with links to resources such as www.sap.com/design-system.

Find out more here:

  • New SAP Design System Portal for SAP Fiori Design Guidelines, and New UI Kits for Designers.

Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite

Consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products ‚Äì no unexpected surprises. We have identified areas directly relevant to users and plan to introduce a number of design updates in SAP Fiori for web across our suite of products to further increase consistency.

The areas we have redesigned and which we plan to provide across our suite of products this year and next year are:

  • Shell bar (at the top of the user‚Äôs screen)
  • Navigation menu: side navigation (see Figure 3 below).
  • User menu
  • Notifications
  • Search in the shell bar

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition already supports the first four of these, you can have a look at them in part 2 of this series, in the section SAP Fiori Launchpad and Design Updates for Suite Consistency:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

As outlined in Part 1, SAP Build Work Zone standard edition also supports side navigation.

Find out more about these design updates here:

  • Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web).

We also provide designers with a refreshed new set of illustrations, to be used for illustrated messages. Figure 3 shows some examples.

Figure 3: Examples of new illustrations. Alt Text: On the left top three different size illustrations showing an ice cream cone fallen on the ground; bottom left an illustration of a globe with a magnifying glass, representing ‚Äúsearch‚Äù. On the right an image of a list report showing the search illustration since no data has been selected.

 

News for Creating Web UIs

Extensibility made easy with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is made much easier since we introduced the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard. The latest update introduces the ability to create an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension.

Figure 4: Creating an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension. Alt Text: Screenshot showing step 1 ‚ÄúExtension‚Äù task where users can select from a row of four cards ‚ÄúCustom Field‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Logic‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Process‚Äù and ‚ÄúUser Interface Extension‚Äù. The latter has a subtext ‚ÄúAdapt the current application or extend it visually with a new application‚Äù. The latter two cards have a link ‚ÄúManage SAP Build Projects‚Äù at the bottom. The bottom right shows two buttons ‚ÄúNext‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù.

Learn more here:

  • SAP Build Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

AI-assisted auto-fix of coding errors with UI5 linter

UI5 linter is the tool of choice to check your UI5 project for using best practices and replacement of deprecated SAPUI5 APIs. With UI5 linter v1.12.0, we are happy to announce the initial version of an autofix feature: Use the "--fix" argument to let UI5 linter apply fixes to your code automatically. Read more about it here:

  • Migrate your code with UI5 linter ‚Äì Autofix has landed.

Legacy-free version of SAPUI5 available via cloud access

Once you have removed code which uses deprecated SAPUI5 APIs, you can try out the legacy-free version of SAP UI5 in the cloud, which has all deprecated code removed. Discover the benefits and how to try it out in this blog post:

  • Explore SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free.

Accessibility taken to the next level: WCAG 2.2 support

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards gives applications a true cutting edge, ensuring that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2.

For example, two of the key new requirements in the 2.2 version are:

  • The minimum target size of an interactive element now needs to be 24x24 px, so that users don‚Äôt accidentally activate a neighbouring element.
  • Each operation that can be performed by dragging can also be performed alternatively without dragging ‚Äì so that people who cannot use a mouse to drag can still use the UI.

See more details:

  • SAPUI5 is Leading the Way in Accessibility with WCAG 2.2

SAP Fiori tools ‚Äì open source, faster app creation, more AI

One of the most powerful recent innovations is the AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools, which allows you to create a fully functional app with database tables, CDS-Views, OData service and a Fiori element list report UI based on a sketch of what you want. I introduced this in my Q1 update post from March. This can now be started from Joule in SAP Build Code. Also, it has been further enhanced, and is also available as open source, so that our developer community can make contributions themselves. Find out more here:

  • From idea to app: using AI-powered Project Accelerator to develop SAP Fiori apps
  • SAP Fiori Application Generator Available in Open Source

For those of you developing in ABAP, we have introduced the new quick SAP Fiori application generator to create and deploy simple SAP Fiori applications from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. Have a closer look:

  • Quickly Generate and Deploy SAP Fiori Apps from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse

To get an overview of these plus some additional enhancements, have a look at:

  • SAP Fiori tools 2506 update ‚Äì Open source, faster app creation, adaptation boost, AI enhancements.

Enhancements for SAP Fiori Elements with OData V4

We are continuously enhancing SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements. I have picked two enhancements to highlight here for developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4, which are covered in the following subsections:

  • Support for inline edit for object pages.
  • Support for the analytical table on the object page.

Support for inline edit for object pages

You can now develop object pages where users can directly edit fields within facets, without having to first press the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button and go into edit mode. Figure 5 shows an example from a test application.

Figure 5: Inline editing of fields in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of part of an object page ‚ÄúTravel‚Äù, which is overall in display mode, but the field ‚ÄúStarting Date‚Äù has been selected and is editable, with a new entry made, and ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù icons next to the field.

Support for the analytical table on the object page

For applications where users need to be able to analyze the data in a table, for example grouping data and aggregating data, developers should use the analytical table rather than the responsive table.

These tables are often used for the ‚Äúlist‚Äù part of an SAP Fiori elements list report, which consists of a list and an object page for the details. Now, developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4 can include an analytical table into one of the facets of an object page. Figure 6 shows an example.

Figure 6: Analytical table in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of an object page with a facet ‚ÄúJournal Entries (4)‚Äù which contains an analytical table, where the entries are grouped by ‚ÄúCase Journal Entry‚Äù. One of the groups is expanded, showing two lines. Below them the sum of the debit column is shown for the expanded group, and below that for the entire table.

Further Updates for SAPUI5

As I described in part 1 of this series, we have introduced a new option to preview an upcoming SAPUI5 version for SAP Build Work Zone. This capability aims to provide a controlled environment for evaluating SAPUI5 updates in SAP Build Work Zone, thereby avoiding immediate changes in production environments:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

Key users can create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility. I described this in the context of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in part 2 of this series (section Key Users Can Rearrange ID and Description Within a Field or Column). They can also easily change the labels used, to fit terms established within the company. Read more about this here:

  • How Key Users Create Consistent Text Changes with SAPUI5 Flexibility.

SAPUI5 has reached a new milestone: it is now used on all 7 continents. Yes, we have reached Antarctica!

  • SAPUI5 adoption becoming more universal.

In case you have not updated your system for a while, then be aware that we are removing SAP Fiori themes Belize and Blue Crystal. Also, make sure that you are using the latest browser versions, which may mean ensuring that your users laptops and desktops are using newer operating system versions:

  • Upcoming Removal of SAP Fiori Themes Belize and Blue Crystal
  • Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 Downtime ‚Äî Check Your Browser Strategy Today!

To get a complete overview of all the enhancements in SAPUI5 including SAP Fiori elements, look at the UI5 demo kit. You‚Äôll find some of the enhancements mentioned above listed under version 1.136.

  • What‚Äôs New in SAP UI5.

 

News for Mobile Designers and Developers

The main news for mobile designers are the new SAP Design System portal, which covers Android and iOS as well as the latest releases of the mobile Figma design kits for Android, iOS, WatchOs and WearOS.

Figure 7: The Android and iOS pages in the new SAP Design System portal. Alt Text: Both screenshots look the same, except for Android vs iOS text. The top has a ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù section, with a row of cards to navigate to UI Elements, UI Kit, Development Documentation. Below that a ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New‚Äù section, with information about the latest release ‚ÄúSAP Fiori for Android version 25.8‚Äù and ‚Äú‚Ä¶for iOS‚Ä¶‚Äù.

The best place to stay up-to-date with these latest enhancements is the respective What‚Äôs New section in the SAP Design System portal:

  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS 25.4: What‚Äôs new for SAP Fiori for iOS
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.8 (design preview) and 25.4: What‚Äôs new for SAP Fiori for Android

Figure 8 shows two of the many new enhancements: the new illustrations mentioned earlier in the section on web UIs are also available for mobile, both for iOS and Android. The other example shown there is the updated date picker for Android, which now allows users to select date ranges.

Figure 8: On the left, an example of the new illustrated messages for mobile. On the right, date ranges can now be selected in the date picker for Android. Alt Text: The illustrated message is used in a pop-over. The illustration shows a sheet of paper with a tickmark, below that the text ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all caught up‚Ä¶‚Äù and two buttons ‚ÄúAdd Task‚Äù and ‚ÄúRemind Me Later‚Äù. On the right two date screens are shown for the month of April: the left one has the 8th marked, the right one has the range from 8th to 16th marked.

Developers get new features with the latest releases of the mobile SDKs, as well as the the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) which is integrated into SAP Build Code. Here are links to find out more about them:

  • What‚Äôs new in Mobile development kit client 25.6, for example:
    • Support grouping in Object Table Control
    • Donut chart support
    • ‚Ä¶ and more.
  • Continuous Innovation in Mobile Design & Technology: SAP Fiori for Android and iOS 25.4
  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS: What‚Äôs New in 25.08
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.4.0 is now available

 

Final words

As you can see from all seven posts in the series, we continue to progress rapidly with the user experience of our product portfolio, especially with regards to AI-assistance.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

For general information on design at SAP and SAP Fiori, check out:

  • www.sap.com/design.
  • www.sap.com/fiori.
  • SAP Community: SAP Fiori topic page.

entry.title: S4 brownfield migration, having ABST2 differences in 2nd & 3rd currency
entry.content:
Hello All,

We are in S4 migration process & executed ABST2 in our source ECC system, balances between FI-AA matching in first local currency, but there are huge differences in second & third currency.

Is it fine if we migrate with this differences or is it going to have any negative impact post migration, if we need to correct what is the way for same - It seems these differences accumulated over the years in ECC.

Please guide on this, any help will be greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Sumesh Gupta

entry.title: Re: The FBL1N report extra fields
entry.content:
To add new fields, not already available in the FBL5N Line Layout selection, you could perform an Extension of Dynamic Selection via SE36. After entering the Logical Database ‚ÄúDDF‚Äù, select Extras -> Selection views. In the view,  it is possible to add or remove available fields into the Dynamic Selection (e.g. additional fields to be available for further selection in the FBL5N Line Layout). Hope this helps.

Kind Regards,

Georgios Sofianos

entry.title: Restricting a custom field to specific level of bucket on portfolio bucket
entry.content:
Hi, 

We are trying to enable a custom field on second level bucket in the hierarchy , we have checked config where it is allowing to enable based on Object type "RBH". We have verified with developers if we can restrict through code and make fields visible for a bucket starting with a specific initial but they mentioned it is not possible. Can someone suggest a way to achieve this.

Thanks &regards,

tejaswi.
